dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

description:
stress is a deliberately simple workload generator for POSIX systems. It
imposes a configurable amount of CPU, memory, I/O, and disk stress on
the system. It is written in C, and is free software licensed under the
GPLv2.
name: stress

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
